Playable Races

Note: You are free to use the Custom Lineage rules introduced in Tasha's Cauldron of Everything for any race, but the rarity, playability, and lore changes described below will remain the same.

Common

  • Human
  • Elf
  • Dwarf
  • Halfling
  • Gnome

Uncommon

  • Aasimar (Human + Celestial)
  • Half-Elf (Human + Elf)
  • Dragonborn (Human + Dragon)
  • Firbolg
  • Goliath
  • Half-Orc (Human + Orc)
  • Lizardfolk
  • Orc
  • Tiefling (Human + Devil; often mistrusted)

Talk to the GM about playing anything below this line!

Weird

Note: While the races below are playable as PCs, they are races that are often not used this setting, so if you choose one of these, you may be the only member of your race you ever see throughout your campaign, and there is not guaranteed to be a group of them anywhere in this setting (so check with the GM when creating your backstory). Many of them are from other planes, worlds, or settings and you may be the only one to have crossed over somehow.

  • Aarakocra
  • Centaur [Lore will be different than on DnDBeyond]
  • Genasi (Human + Genie)
  • Gith
  • Grung
  • Kobold
  • Leonin [Lore will be different than on DnDBeyond]
  • Locathah
  • Loxodon [Lore will be different than on DnDBeyond]
  • Satyr [Lore will be different than on DnDBeyond]
  • Tabaxi
  • Tortle
  • Triton
  • Vedalken [Lore will be different than on DnDBeyond]
  • Verdan

Monsters

WARNING: Discuss with your party and GM before playing one of these, as it can affect the entire party and campaign (you may even be attacked on sight in most places)

  • Bugbear [Lore will be different than on DnDBeyond]
  • Changeling (Human + Doppelganger)
  • Goblin
  • Hobgoblin [Lore will be different than on DnDBeyond]
  • Minotaur [Lore will be different than on DnDBeyond]
  • Shifter (Human + Lycanthrope)
  • Simic Hybrid [Lore will be different than on DnDBeyond]
  • Yuan-Ti Pureblood [Lore will be different than on DnDBeyond]

Non-playable in this setting

  • Kalashtar (there is no plane of dreams, and ghosts are not usually lawful good)
  • Kenku (ask for GM permission if you REALLY want to roleplay a character with no voice of its own)
  • Warforged (mechanical constructs are very different here than in Eberon)
  • Anything not yet on this list; see GM
